column3: description
Meta uses this information to verify your identity and to keep our community safe. You decide what personal details you make visible to others.
Meta uses this information to verify your identity and to keep our community safe. You decide what personal details you make visible to others.
Meta uses this information to verify your identity and to keep our community safe.
Manage your data, modify your legacy contact, deactivate or delete your accounts and profiles.

Allows the user to export a copy of their information to an external service or their device. The available information includes content and info you've shared, your activity, and info the service collects. The export does not include information that someone else shared, such as another person's photos that you're tagged in.
View recent activity from businesses and organizations that share information with Meta, such as zillow.com, lithub.com, and more.
Allows the user to disconnect specific activity that businesses have shared with Meta.
Allows the user to clear their history of activity off Meta technologies.
Allows the user to control or disconnect future information that businesses send to Meta.

column2: Do you want us to use your activity information from ad partners to show you ads?
column3: This setting controls whether your activity information from ad partners is used to personalize the ads you see. Selecting 'Yes' results in more relevant ads based on what you already like. Selecting 'No' means your ads will use less of your information and be more generic.
column4: Yes, show me ads that are more relevant by using this information

column3: Profile information about your employer is used to help personalize your ads.
Profile information about your job title is used to help personalize your ads.
Profile information about your education is used to help personalize your ads.
Profile information about your relationship status is used to help personalize your ads.
Advertisers can reach you based on the category 'People who have a birthday in July'. You can remove yourself from this category.
Advertisers can reach you based on the category 'People who primarily access Facebook using Google Chrome'. You can remove yourself from this category.
Advertisers can reach you based on the category 'People who primarily access Facebook using mobile devices'. You can remove yourself from this category.

column2: Ads from ad partners in other apps
column3: You can choose whether you want to see ads from ad partners in other apps. The information we use to show you these ads is based on your Ad settings. Businesses not owned by Meta may use Meta's ad services to show you ads in other apps.
column4: Show me ads from ad partners

column3: Allows the user to manage their inclusion in the advertising audience for MentR-Me (@MentrMe1) and decide whether the platform can show ads from this advertiser based on this data.
Allows the user to manage their inclusion in the advertising audience for Student Beans (@StudentBeans) and decide whether the platform can show ads from this advertiser based on this data.
Allows the user to manage their inclusion in the advertising audience for Uniqlo Canada (@UNIQLOCanada) and decide whether the platform can show ads from this advertiser based on this data.

Allows the user to manage their inclusion in the advertising audience for QS Top Universities Latin America (@QSTopUniversitiesLatinAmerica) and decide whether the platform can show ads from this advertiser based on this data.
View more advertisers whose audiences you have been included in.
Manage your passwords, login preferences and recovery methods. This option navigates to the password change screen.
Manage your passwords, login preferences and recovery methods. This option navigates to the two-factor authentication setup screen.
Manage your passwords, login preferences and recovery methods. This option navigates to the saved login information screen.
Manage your passwords, login preferences and recovery methods. This option navigates to the passkey management screen.
Review security issues by running checks across apps, devices and emails sent. This option shows where your account is currently logged in.
Review security issues by running checks across apps, devices and emails sent. This option allows you to manage alerts for unrecognized logins.
Review security issues by running checks across apps, devices and emails sent. This option shows recent security-related emails sent from the service.
Review security issues by running checks across apps, devices and emails sent. This option starts a guided review of your security settings.
Select the account or profile for which to manage search history.
Controls the duration for which search history is retained.
An action to delete all of your search history.
Manage the email addresses associated with your account.
Manage the phone numbers associated with your account.
Manage passkeys for signing in.
View and manage your active sessions.
View and manage devices that have saved your password.
Add an extra layer of security to your account.
Download larger data archive, including connections, verifications, contacts, account history, and information we infer about you based on your profile and activity.
Select the data files you're most interested in.
Select to include Articles in the data download.
Select to include Invitations in the data download.
Select to include Profile data in the data download.
Select to include Recommendations in the data download.
Select to include Registration data in the data download.
Clear all previous searches performed on LinkedIn. Your search history is only visible to you, and it helps us to show you better results.
Allows the user to provide or edit their demographic information to help promote fairness and diversity on LinkedIn.
Allows the user to remove all personal demographic information they have provided. The button label is 'Remove'.
Can we enable trusted third-party partners to use data about you for social, economic, and workplace research?

column2: Use my data for training content creation AI models
column3: Can LinkedIn and its affiliates use your personal data and content you create on LinkedIn to train generative AI models that create content? When this setting is on, LinkedIn and its affiliates can use your data and content to train content-generating AI models that are used in product features. The data we use for this purpose does not include your private messages.

column2: Who can send you invitations to connect?
column3: Controls which group of users can send you connection invitations. The available options are: Everyone on LinkedIn, Only people who know your email address or appear in your 'Imported Contacts' list, and Only people who appear in your 'Imported Contacts' list.
Allow your network and pages you engage with to send you invitations to follow pages?
Allow your network to send you event invitations?
Allow your network to send you invitations to subscribe to newsletters?
Allow your network to send you invitations to follow them
Allows others to send you message requests notifications?
Allow others to send you InMail? InMail allows you to directly message another LinkedIn member that you're not connected to.
Allow recruiters to invite you to apply for jobs? Allow recruiters to send you messages with job card.
Allow LinkedIn or third-party partners to send you invitations for participating in product feedback surveys, market research, and other studies?
Can LinkedIn personalize how it promotes LinkedIn's own products to you on and off LinkedIn, based on your LinkedIn activity and profile? These promotions help you get the most out of our products.
Can LinkedIn send you promotional emails to help you maximize the benefits of LinkedIn's products, based on your LinkedIn activity and profile?

Do you want LinkedIn to sort your messages by relevance into a Focused tab and Other tab? When Focused Inbox is enabled, messages most relevant to you are sorted into the Focused tab while the rest remain easily accessible - but out of the way - in the Other tab.
When messaging a connection who has it enabled, both of you will be able to see when each other is typing and when the message is read.
Allow LinkedIn to show you Messaging suggestions, some of which are personalized using automated systems to recognize patterns in messages?
Receive reminders about messages you haven't responded to.

Do you want LinkedIn's automated processes to detect certain policy violations by others, such as harassment, for the messages that are sent to you? When this setting is turned on, our automated processes will attempt to detect harmful content in the messages you receive that violate our Professional Community Policies.
Share your profile with the job poster when you click Apply on a job that redirects you outside of LinkedIn? Turning this setting on may increase your chances of being viewed by the job poster.

Use your job alerts to signal interest to recruiters working at those companies. Opting into this setting sends a signal to recruiters who may want to contact a member, whenever a member creates a job alert for a company the recruiters work for.
A link to a page for managing job alerts.

Can we use information from your 1st-degree connections to show you more tailored ads on LinkedIn? This setting also applies to Ads outside of LinkedIn if that setting is turned on. Turning this off may make your ads less tailored, but won't reduce the number of ads you see.

Can we use the list of companies you follow to show you more tailored ads on LinkedIn? This setting also applies to Ads outside of LinkedIn if that setting is turned on. Turning this off may make your ads less tailored, but won't reduce the number of ads you see.

Can we use the groups you've joined to show you more tailored ads on LinkedIn? This setting also applies to Ads outside of LinkedIn if that setting is turned on. Turning this off may make your ads less tailored, but won't reduce the number of ads you see.
Allow LinkedIn to use your schools information to show you more tailored ads.
Allow LinkedIn to use your field of study information to show you more tailored ads.
Allow LinkedIn to use your degrees information to show you more tailored ads.
Allow LinkedIn to use your skills information to show you more tailored ads.
Allow LinkedIn to use your last graduation year information to show you more tailored ads.
Allow LinkedIn to use your current job information to show you more tailored ads.
Allow LinkedIn to use your past jobs information to show you more tailored ads.
What employer history can we use to show you more tailored ads on LinkedIn? - Current company
What employer history can we use to show you more tailored ads on LinkedIn? - Past companies

column2: Use profile data for customized display
column3: Can we use your profile information (such as your photo, name, and company) to display ads to you on LinkedIn in a customized format? Ads formatted to display your profile information are visible only to you.

column2: Use postal code and city you enter in your profile
column3: Can we use the postal code and city you enter in your profile to show you more tailored ads on LinkedIn? If you turn this off, you may still see ads based on your country or continent.
We may infer your city from your IP address. Can we use that data to show you personalized ads on LinkedIn? If you turn this off, you may still see ads based on your country or continent
Can we use interests and traits we derived from your LinkedIn profile and activity to show you more tailored ads on LinkedIn?

column2: Use your age range for ads
column3: Can we use your age range (from your profile or inferred) to show you more tailored ads on LinkedIn?
Can we use your gender (from your profile or inferred) to show you more tailored ads on LinkedIn?

Allows LinkedIn to show you personalized ads on other websites and services (off of LinkedIn). These personalized ads will be shown on all your devices whether or not you are logged into our services.
Can we use data about you that we get from others to show you more personalized ads? This includes data about your engagement with other services or information that you've given to our advertisers.

column2: Use your data for evaluating ad success
column3: Can we use data about actions you took in response to ads to give advertisers aggregate reports about how their ads performed?

column2: Data sharing with our affiliates and select partners
column3: Controls whether LinkedIn can share your data with its affiliates and select partners for advertising off LinkedIn. Affiliates use this data to personalize and show you ads, and select partners use this data to show you marketing messages from LinkedIn. If you turn this off, you will still see ads, but they won't be personalized with your LinkedIn data.
